Articles.Content:
I don't know where else to ask this question, and since I figure somebody here might know the answer, here goes...

OK, I'm an idiot.  CurgeForge recently made changes, and now I can't figure out how to edit my own projects.  As I recall, what I use to do was just go to the project page and it would let me edit stuff, upload files, delete files, etc.  But now I've got no owner control at all.  I just see what everybody else see with no means to edit.  What am I doing wrong?  How to I gain access to my own projects to edit them?  I see no buttons or options anywhere that allows me to do that.

 

 

Edited March 28, 2018 by OhioBob

There are two CurseForge sites, https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/ and https://www.curseforge.com/kerbal/ksp-mods/
Only the first one will allow you to edit your mods.

10 hours ago, pizzaoverhead said:

There are two CurseForge sites, https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/ and https://www.curseforge.com/kerbal/ksp-mods/
Only the first one will allow you to edit your mods.

Thanks, but that project page is where I've been going.  I use to be able to edit from there no problem.  But now it's still not letting me edit anything.

Maybe it's this Twitch authentication thing.  I had problems with that.  It says I'm logged in, but maybe not.
 

Edited March 30, 2018 by OhioBob
